remarks: The evaluation functor is a bifunctor (a two-argument functor) with the first parameter taking values in the set of functors ` C --> D ` , and the second parameter in ` D ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Jan-2017.)
statement:
evlfcl.e $e |- E = ( C evalF D ) $.
evlfcl.q $e |- Q = ( C FuncCat D ) $.
evlfcl.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. Cat ) $.
evlfcl.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. Cat ) $.
evlfcl $p |- ( ph -> E e. ( ( Q Xc. C ) Func D ) ) $.
